image.altText: A large crowd of people queue at Sydney airport

props.synopsis: A massive IT systems outage caused by issues with CrowdStrike software is affecting banks, airports, supermarkets and media companies across Australia and around the world. Follow live.

title.children: 'Completely unprecedented' outage causes havoc with IT systems across globe

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: CrowdStrike CEO admits it could take 'some time' for some customers' systems to 'recover'
CrowdStrike CEO apologises 'to anyone affected' by outage
Microsoft acknowledges continuing impacts on apps and services despite CrowdStrike 'fix'

image.altText: A currency shop screen shows the Windows error message ":(" as people line up

props.synopsis: CrowdStrike CEO George Kurtz says a global tech outage affecting various businesses was caused by a "defect" in a "single content update" for Windows hosts.

title.children: Global outage caused by a 'defect' in a 'single content update', CrowdStrike says

image.altText: Anthony Albanese speaking at a media conference.

props.synopsis: Australian government agencies, retailers, banks and airlines call an emergency meeting after a widespread IT outage grounds flights, interrupts payment systems leaves and media outlets unable to operate.

title.children: 'No impact to critical infrastructure': Australian government holds snap crisis meeting over CrowdStrike outage

image.altText: A man with wearing a black suit jacket with gray hair walks through a doorway .

props.synopsis: After a retrial, Geraldton's Thomas "Graham" Greenaway has been jailed for at least two years and nine months for stealing $2.9 million from the Yugunga-Nya people's trust while he was trustee.

title.children: Former pub owner jailed again for stealing nearly $3m from Aboriginal charitable trust after retrial

image.altText: Two men, George Burns and James Mumme, stand near the ocean.

props.synopsis: Rockingham residents express alarm at the prospect of a radioactive waste facility at HMAS Stirling naval base on Garden Island, following a decision by the nuclear safety watchdog to approve a plan to prepare a site for one.

title.children: 'Cold War' fears for residents south of Perth as nuclear waste facility clears hurdle

image.altText: Two men looking at the camera

props.synopsis: Two brothers have faced court over an alleged shooting in southern Western Australia which left another man with gunshot wounds to his hands.

title.children: Court told of 'big, orange flame' as brothers allegedly fired shotgun at man after doing burnouts

image.altText: Two women walking outside towards the camera

props.synopsis: A childcare worker accused of assaulting preschoolers at an early learning centre in Perth's north is found guilty of just five of the 32 charges she was facing.

title.children: Perth childcare worker found guilty of scratching children in her care, but acquitted of most charges

image.altText: A man in a suit surrounded by lights

props.synopsis: In a 92-minute speech, Donald Trump used Joe Biden's name only once, and asked a roaring crowd of party faithful to send him back to the White House. Meanwhile, the president endured another day of leaks and anonymous sources citing pressure for him to drop out of the race.

title.children: 'Blood everywhere': Trump describes shooting and Melania returns, as Republican Convention reaches crescendo

image.altText: The Crowdstrike logo, red and white with an eagle swooping down

props.synopsis: The global outage impacts a raft of Australian companies and government agencies. Here's the latest on the company reportedly responsible.

title.children: What is CrowdStrike, the American cybersecurity firm linked to today's global outage?

image.altText: AFL assistant coach Dean Cox smiles at training.

props.synopsis: West Coast club legend Dean Cox rules himself out of the running for the Eagles vacant coaching role, opting instead to stay in Sydney with the Swans.

title.children: Dean Cox resists lure of West Coast coaching job, opts to stay in Sydney

image.altText: A grinning Adelaide AFL player raises his thumbs above his head in celebration after a big goal.

props.synopsis: The Crows hit the front from a Josh Rachele goal with under a minute to go to beat the Bombers at Docklands in a Friday night thriller. Follow live.

title.children: Rachele rescues the win for Adelaide as Bombers go down at Docklands

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: FT: Adelaide Crows beat Essendon by two points
HT: Adelaide leads Essendon by 23 points

image.altText: Dave holding a brush, standing in front of the large cowboy he painted.

props.synopsis: The craft of sign painting has taken a hit in the digital era but painters like Dave Johnson say computers cannot replicate the charm of hand-produced pieces.

title.children: Old-school sign painter battles against computers to keep lost art alive

image.altText: A wrought iron sign with white lettering which says Welcome to Nannup District High School,

props.synopsis: Parents say a government review of struggling regional school in Western Australia doesn't do enough to address the Education Department's poor handling of the situation.

title.children: Parents say review into struggling country school where enrolments have plummeted doesn't go far enough

image.altText: a man stands near a ute with the contents of a first aid kit on display

props.synopsis: Farmsafe Australia wants all agriculture workers to have first aid and trauma response training, saying it can be the difference between life and death in remote areas.

title.children: New group cracks down on rural workplace safety after 32 deaths on Australian farms in a year

image.altText: Shoko Miyata hands off the high bars

props.synopsis: The 19-year-old gymnastics star will sit out the Paris Olympics after violating the team's code of conduct by smoking and consuming alcohol in the lead-up to the Games.

title.children: 'We apologise from the bottom of our hearts': Japan's gymnastics captain Shoko Miyata out of Olympics due to smoking

image.altText: Joe Biden, wearing a cap, slacks and a jumper, waves as he descends the stairs of an airplane

props.synopsis: The US president, currently isolating with COVID-19, is said to be reflecting on whether to drop out as the presumptive Democratic candidate in the November election.

title.children: Biden reportedly 'soul-searching' on whether to stay in 2024 presidential race, as Obama privately expresses concerns

image.altText: A pencil and watercolour sketch of a historic two-storey building with shops on the street level

props.synopsis: Comic artist Jo Waite has spent her adult life renting and squatting in Melbourne's inner suburbs, watching gentrification unfold in real time. Now, she is drawing her old homes one by one — but the beauty of the grand homes hides the reality of life inside them for tenants in decades past.

title.children: 'The call of a million dollars': How gentrification changed the neighbourhoods that were once affordable to artists

image.altText: Three researchers hold small fish in water and give a thumbs up to the camera above them.

props.synopsis: Researchers say there is evidence that previously unknown breeding "nurseries" for critically endangered green sawfish could disappear due to continuing habitat loss in northern Western Australia.

title.children: Green sawfish are already under threat but development in WA's north could make matters worse

image.altText: A man in a safety vest and hard hat smiles from a platform above a power station

props.synopsis: A feasibility study with AGL to explore green hydrogen possibilities at the now-closed Liddell coal-fired power station looks to be on the backburner. But Fortescue chairman Andrew Forrest insist he's not walking away from hydrogen.

title.children: Fortescue-backed green hydrogen partnership on hold after job cuts at metals giant

image.altText: A close up shows a red cap with white text in all caps saying TRUMP FOREVER

props.synopsis: Trump's speech, and the entire atmosphere of the Republican National Convention, are reminders of America's new direction. They're also a chance to recall his record in office and judge it against what he's offering now.

title.children: Trump is not a blip, he's the correction. The Republican Party on show this week is the new normal

image.altText: A man standing near sunflowers out the front of his suburban home.

props.synopsis: Home ownership is a cornerstone of the Australian dream — but for many it feels increasingly out of reach.

title.children: Donggang's home has doubled in value since he bought — but he's not happy about it

image.altText: Two emergency service officers in an area cordoned off by red tape

props.synopsis: The Israeli army reviews a blast in central Tel Aviv which made it through the IDF's aerial defences, with Yemen's Houthi militants claiming responsibility for a "military operation" in the city.

title.children: Yemen's Houthis claim military operation in Tel Aviv as IDF investigates explosion

image.altText: a man wearing glasses standing outdoors in front of a media pack

props.synopsis: The former NSW Liberal leader, who was the state's premier from October 2021 to March 2023, announces his resignation from politics and will head up BHP's office in Washignton DC.

title.children: Perrottet lands plum job in US after announcing end of his political career

image.altText: A closeup shot of the prime minister looking sombre, wearing glasses and frowning

props.synopsis: No doubt the administrators will clean out the CFMEU. But you'd be an optimist to feel confident that one collection of bad applies won't eventually be replaced by another.

title.children: The bad apples at the CFMEU are on the way out. The next crop deserves close attention

image.altText: Two police officers are in uniform with their faces blurred out. In the background are houses and empty land

props.synopsis: Police are ordered to reinvestigate allegations they used unreasonable force against kids during a shopping centre scuffle.

title.children: Watch this police officer's response when he's asked, 'How many Black kids are you going to assault?'

image.altText: Two small snowmen made from sleet on a car park ground in Guyra New Suoth Wales

props.synopsis: Parts of eastern Australia are set for another round of fierce wintry weather, with warnings of damaging winds for several states, and blizzards in Australia's alpine regions from Friday.

title.children: Damaging winds, snow and rain forecast for eastern Australia

image.altText: Hacking

props.synopsis: eScripts provider MediSecure has revealed 12.9 million Australians had personal data stolen in a cyber breach earlier this year, making it one of the largest data hacks in Australian history.

title.children: MediSecure 'not in a financial position' to identify 12.9m Australians who had data stolen

image.altText: A close up of Greg Lynn standing in front of a body of water near some rocks.

props.synopsis: Former Jetstar pilot Greg Lynn will appeal his murder conviction, his lawyer says, after he was found guilty of killing retiree Carol Clay in Victoria's High Country.

title.children: Media reports about Greg Lynn have 'poisoned the well of justice', lawyer tells court

image.altText: Nuclear and Canada picture

props.synopsis: Canadian experts say it's not too late for Australia to build a nuclear power industry. But should we?

title.children: What Australia can learn from Canada's nuclear power industry

image.altText: A green bus driving on a road.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's biggest private bus companies turns down government funding that would have gone directly to driver wage increases, leaked documents show.

title.children: Bus company refuses government-funded wage rises for its own drivers

image.altText: ATO Melbourne office, logo on the wall.

props.synopsis: The message is clear: the honeymoon period is now over for businesses that were extended during the COVID-19 pandemic, as the ATO works to recoup more than $50 billion in debt.

title.children: How the ATO went from good cop to bad cop to claw back more than $50 billion in debt

image.altText: A blonde white woman wearing a pink suit raises her hands in celebration and smiles

props.synopsis: The German former defence minister outlined the climate crisis and European Union defence cooperation as the focus for her five-year term.

title.children: Von der Leyen pledges strong defence union and green transition in new EU term
